contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses2|Nimrod}} {| {{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[File:Nimrodheldupinice.jpg|250px]] |Ship caption=The ''Nimrod'' }} {{Infobox ship career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag= |Ship name=''Nimrod'' |Ship namesake= [[Nimrod]] |Ship ordered= |Ship builder= Stephen, [[Dundee]]<ref name="Miramar" /> |Ship yard number=36 |Ship original cost= |Ship laid down= |Ship launched= |Ship completed=January 1867<ref name="Miramar" /> |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship honours= |Ship captured= |Ship fate= Sold 1909; wrecked 1919 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= |Ship tonnage= 334 [[Gross Register Tons|GRT]]<ref name="Miramar" /> |Ship length= |Ship beam= |Ship draught= |Ship draft= |Ship hold depth= |Ship propulsion= Sails, auxiliary steam engine |Ship sail plan= Originally [[schooner]], rebuilt as [[barquentine]] |Ship complement= |Ship armament= |Ship notes= |Ship speed= {{convert|6|kn|km/h}} under steam }} |} '''''Nimrod''''' was the ship used by [[Ernest Shackleton]] in his 1908 [[Antarctica|Antarctic]] [[Nimrod Expedition]] for the [[South Pole]]. It was a 41-year-old [[schooner]] of 334 [[gross register ton]]s which had been used to hunt seals<ref name="Paine" /> and whales.<ref name="Miramar" /> Shackleton, who paid £5,000 for the ship, had it re-rigged as a [[barquentine]]. It also had an auxiliary steam engine, but had a top speed of only six knots under this power. In addition, the ship was so overloaded with supplies for the expedition that it could not carry enough coal to make passage to the Antarctic from [[New Zealand]], and Shackleton had to arrange for the ship to be towed to the edge of the pack ice by a tramp steamer ''Koonya''. The New Zealand government paid half the cost of the tow, Sir James Mills, Chairman of the Union Steamship Company paid the other half. The ''Koonya'' was captained by Fredrick Pryce Evans during the tow. ''Nimrod'' was initially captained by [[Rupert England]], but Shackleton was dissatisfied with him and replaced him with [[Frederick Pryce Evans]], who commanded the ship on the relief voyage in 1909. ''Nimrod'' was sold on Shackleton's return to [[Great Britain]]. ''Nimrod'''s fate, 10 years after its return from the Antarctic, was to be battered to pieces in the [[North Sea]], after running aground on the Barber Sands off the [[Norfolk]] (UK) coast on 31 January 1919. Only two of her 12-person crew survived.<ref name="Riffenburgh" /> A number of geographic features of Antarctica were named after this ship, including [[Nimrod Glacier]]. == References == {{reflist | refs = <ref name="Miramar"> {{cite web | url = http://www.miramarshipindex.org.nz/ship/list?search_op=OR&IDNo=1055047 | title = Search results for "1055047" | publisher = Miramar Ship Index | accessdate = 31 December 2008 }} </ref> <ref name="Paine"> {{cite book | last = Paine | first = Lincoln P. | year = 2000 | pages = 102 | title = Ships of Discovery and Exploration | publisher = Houghton Mifflin Harcourt | location = Boston | url = http://books.google.com/books?id=kpMGlc-cvAoC&pg=PA102&lpg=PA102&dq=Nimrod+sealer+tonnage | isbn = 978-0-395-98415-4 }} </ref> <ref name="Riffenburgh"> {{cite book | last = Riffenburgh | first = Beau | authorlink = Beau Riffenburgh | year = 2004 | pages = 306–7 | title = Nimrod: Ernest Shackleton and the Extraordinary Story of the 1907–09 British Antarctic Expedition | publisher = Bloomsbury Publishing | location = London | isbn = 0-7475-7253-4 }} </ref> }} {{Polar exploration|state=collapsed}} [[Category:Exploration ships of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Schooners]] [[Category:Barquentines]] [[Category:Merchant ships of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:1867 ships]] [[Category:Auxiliary steamers]] {{Merchantship-stub}}
